text: Sharing again in case anyone can help this morning! :slightly_smiling_face:

Hi everyone,
I'm working on tracking email events through the HubSpot API using the following endpoint:
`<https://api.hubapi.com/email/public/v1/events?recipient=xyz@abc.com&eventType=SENT&limit=100>`
My approach is to use the `sentBy` ID as a unique key to match events for `OPEN`, `DELIVERED`, and `SENT`. For example, if the `sentBy` ID appears in both `SENT` and `DELIVERED` or `OPEN` events, it indicates that the email was first sent, then successfully delivered, and eventually opened by the client.
However, I am encountering a discrepancy where HubSpot UI shows the event as "DELIVERED", but according to my logic, it should be marked as "OPEN".
Can anyone help resolve this issue, or should I consider using a different API or approach to track these email events more accurately?

I tried to copy paste test survey suffix link and test it on my site but it's not showing. I tried to test it on <http://google.com|google.com> and it's not showing either. how do I show it?
`?hsWebSurveyPreview=NPS&hsWebSurveyTestId={id}`

Are there any issues currently with custom coded actions in workflows?

I have mutliple workflow which make an API call to a 3rd party with information from a contact or a deal. has worked for months, untouched - suddenly they are all returning an error that the properties are not being passed on correctly. Checked the code, everything is as it should be.

Is anyone else having the same issue?

happening to me with workflow webhooks
no body is being sent with them

Mine has now come back and it working as normal again with no need for adjustments to code...

Perhaps the service went down briefly and will be coming back up?

it was certainly a 30-45 minutes or pure panic...
yes, looks like its coming back now

:sparkles:Slack Tips and Best Practices:sparkles:

To get the most out the HubSpot Developer Slack, follow these best practices:

• Will your post/question potentially help more than one person? Ask in a public channel instead of 1:1 DMs to help as many folks as possible. 
• Thread all replies to keep topics organized and searchable
• Thread followup questions/comments to your original post
• Don't post the same question in multiple channels. If you must, link to your original question in new channels.
More <https://slack.com/blog/collaboration/etiquette-tips-in-slack|great tips here>. Thanks for making the HubSpot Developer Slack easier to use for everyone!
Hey <@U0707T1CCK0> can you try posting this in the <https://community.HubSpot.com/|HubSpot Community>? I think you'll be more likely to get an answer there
Check the details on the "OPEN" event - there are opens that get filtered out due to activity that looks like mail security bots doing "pre-opening" and scanning emails
I think those get marked with some field that says "probably not bot", or something to that effect
